trans-unit.source: Games and DirectX
trans-unit.target: Games and DirectX

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) offers new opportunities to create, distribute, and monetize games.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) offers new opportunities to create, distribute, and monetize games.

trans-unit.source: Learn about starting a new game or porting an existing game.
trans-unit.target: Learn about starting a new game or porting an existing game.

trans-unit.source: Games and DirectX
trans-unit.target: Games and DirectX

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) offers new opportunities to create, distribute, and monetize games.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) offers new opportunities to create, distribute, and monetize games.

trans-unit.source: Learn about starting a new game or porting an existing game.
trans-unit.target: Learn about starting a new game or porting an existing game.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 game development guide
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 game development guide

trans-unit.source: An end-to-end guide to resources and information for developing UWP games.
trans-unit.target: An end-to-end guide to resources and information for developing UWP games.

trans-unit.source: Game technologies for Universal Windows Platform apps
trans-unit.target: Game technologies for Universal Windows Platform apps

trans-unit.source: In this guide, you'll learn about the technologies available for developing UWP games.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, you'll learn about the technologies available for developing UWP games.

trans-unit.source: Project templates and tools for games
trans-unit.target: Project templates and tools for games

trans-unit.source: Shows you what you need to start programming DirectX games for the UWP.
trans-unit.target: Shows you what you need to start programming DirectX games for the UWP.

trans-unit.source: The app object and DirectX
trans-unit.target: The app object and DirectX

trans-unit.source: UWP with DirectX games don't use many of the Windows UI user interface elements and objects.
trans-unit.target: UWP with DirectX games don't use many of the Windows UI user interface elements and objects.

trans-unit.source: Rather, because they run at a lower level in the Windows Runtime stack, they must interoperate with the user interface framework in a more fundamental way: by accessing and interoperating with the app object directly.
trans-unit.target: Rather, because they run at a lower level in the Windows Runtime stack, they must interoperate with the user interface framework in a more fundamental way: by accessing and interoperating with the app object directly.

trans-unit.source: Learn when and how this interoperation occurs, and how you, as a DirectX developer, can effectively use this model in the development of your UWP app.
trans-unit.target: Learn when and how this interoperation occurs, and how you, as a DirectX developer, can effectively use this model in the development of your UWP app.

trans-unit.source: Launching and resuming apps
trans-unit.target: Launching and resuming apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to launch, suspend, and resume your UWP DirectX app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to launch, suspend, and resume your UWP DirectX app.

trans-unit.source: 2D graphics for DirectX games
trans-unit.target: 2D graphics for DirectX games

trans-unit.source: We discuss the use of 2D bitmap graphics and effects, and how to use them in your game.
trans-unit.target: We discuss the use of 2D bitmap graphics and effects, and how to use them in your game.

trans-unit.source: Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games
trans-unit.target: Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games

trans-unit.source: We show how to use DirectX programming to implement the fundamental concepts of 3D graphics.
trans-unit.target: We show how to use DirectX programming to implement the fundamental concepts of 3D graphics.

trans-unit.source: Load resources in your DirectX game
trans-unit.target: Load resources in your DirectX game

trans-unit.source: Most games, at some point, load resources and assets (such as shaders, textures, predefined meshes or other graphics data) from local storage or some other data stream.
trans-unit.target: Most games, at some point, load resources and assets (such as shaders, textures, predefined meshes or other graphics data) from local storage or some other data stream.

trans-unit.source: Here, we walk you through a high-level view of what you must consider when loading these files to use in your UWP game.
trans-unit.target: Here, we walk you through a high-level view of what you must consider when loading these files to use in your UWP game.

trans-unit.source: Create a simple UWP game with DirectX
trans-unit.target: Create a simple UWP game with DirectX

trans-unit.source: In this set of tutorials, you learn how to create a basic UWP game with DirectX and C++.
trans-unit.target: In this set of tutorials, you learn how to create a basic UWP game with DirectX and C++.

trans-unit.source: We cover all the major parts of a game, including the processes for loading assets such as arts and meshes, creating a main game loop, implementing a simple rendering pipeline, and adding sound and controls.
trans-unit.target: We cover all the major parts of a game, including the processes for loading assets such as arts and meshes, creating a main game loop, implementing a simple rendering pipeline, and adding sound and controls.

trans-unit.source: Developing Marble Maze, a Universal Windows Platform game in C++ and DirectX
trans-unit.target: Developing Marble Maze, a Universal Windows Platform game in C++ and DirectX

trans-unit.source: This section of the documentation describes how to use DirectX and Visual C++ to create a 3-D UWP game.
trans-unit.target: This section of the documentation describes how to use DirectX and Visual C++ to create a 3-D UWP game.

trans-unit.source: This documentation shows how to create a 3-D game named Marble Maze that embraces new form factors such as tablets and also works on traditional desktop and laptop PCs.
trans-unit.target: This documentation shows how to create a 3-D game named Marble Maze that embraces new form factors such as tablets and also works on traditional desktop and laptop PCs.

trans-unit.source: Supporting screen orientation
trans-unit.target: Supporting screen orientation

trans-unit.source: Here, we'll discuss best practices for handling screen rotation in your UWP DirectX app, so that the Windows 10 device's graphics hardware are used efficiently and effectively.
trans-unit.target: Here, we'll discuss best practices for handling screen rotation in your UWP DirectX app, so that the Windows 10 device's graphics hardware are used efficiently and effectively.

trans-unit.source: Audio for games
trans-unit.target: Audio for games

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop and incorporate music and sounds into your DirectX game, and how to process the audio signals to create dynamic and positional sounds.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop and incorporate music and sounds into your DirectX game, and how to process the audio signals to create dynamic and positional sounds.

trans-unit.source: Touch controls for games
trans-unit.target: Touch controls for games

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add basic touch controls to your UWP C++ game with DirectX.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add basic touch controls to your UWP C++ game with DirectX.

trans-unit.source: We show you how to add touch-based controls to move a fixed-plane camera in a Direct3D environment, where dragging with a finger or stylus shifts the camera perspective.
trans-unit.target: We show you how to add touch-based controls to move a fixed-plane camera in a Direct3D environment, where dragging with a finger or stylus shifts the camera perspective.

trans-unit.source: Move-look controls for games
trans-unit.target: Move-look controls for games

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add traditional mouse and keyboard move-look controls (also known as mouselook controls) to your DirectX game.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add traditional mouse and keyboard move-look controls (also known as mouselook controls) to your DirectX game.

trans-unit.source: Optimize input and rendering loop
trans-unit.target: Optimize input and rendering loop

trans-unit.source: Input latency can significantly impact the experience of a game, and optimizing it can make a game feel more polished.
trans-unit.target: Input latency can significantly impact the experience of a game, and optimizing it can make a game feel more polished.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, proper input event optimization can improve battery life.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, proper input event optimization can improve battery life.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to choose the right [CoreDispatcher](optimize-performance-for-windows-store-direct3d-11-apps-with-coredispatcher.md) input event processing options to make sure your game handles input as smoothly as possible.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to choose the right [CoreDispatcher](optimize-performance-for-windows-store-direct3d-11-apps-with-coredispatcher.md) input event processing options to make sure your game handles input as smoothly as possible.

trans-unit.source: Swap chain scaling and overlays
trans-unit.target: Swap chain scaling and overlays

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create scaled swap chains for faster rendering on mobile devices, and use overlay swap chains (when available) to increase the visual quality.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create scaled swap chains for faster rendering on mobile devices, and use overlay swap chains (when available) to increase the visual quality.

trans-unit.source: Reduce latency with DXGI 1.3 swap chains
trans-unit.target: Reduce latency with DXGI 1.3 swap chains

trans-unit.source: Use DXGI 1.3 to reduce the effective frame latency by waiting for the swap chain to signal the appropriate time to begin rendering a new frame.
trans-unit.target: Use DXGI 1.3 to reduce the effective frame latency by waiting for the swap chain to signal the appropriate time to begin rendering a new frame.

trans-unit.source: Multisampling in UWP apps
trans-unit.target: Multisampling in UWP apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use multisampling in UWP apps built with Direct3D.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use multisampling in UWP apps built with Direct3D.

trans-unit.source: Handle device removed scenarios in Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Handle device removed scenarios in Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to recreate the Direct3D and DXGI device interface chain when the graphics adapter is removed or reinitialized.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to recreate the Direct3D and DXGI device interface chain when the graphics adapter is removed or reinitialized.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous programming for games
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous programming for games

trans-unit.source: This topic covers various points to consider when you are using asynchronous programming and threading with DirectX.
trans-unit.target: This topic covers various points to consider when you are using asynchronous programming and threading with DirectX.

trans-unit.source: Networking for games
trans-unit.target: Networking for games

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop and incorporate networking features into your DirectX game.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop and incorporate networking features into your DirectX game.

trans-unit.source: DirectX and XAML interop
trans-unit.target: DirectX and XAML interop

trans-unit.source: You can use Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) and Microsoft DirectX together in your UWP game.
trans-unit.target: You can use Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) and Microsoft DirectX together in your UWP game.

trans-unit.source: Package your game
trans-unit.target: Package your game

trans-unit.source: Larger UWP games, especially those that support multiple languages with region-specific assets or feature optional high-definition assets, can easily balloon to large sizes.
trans-unit.target: Larger UWP games, especially those that support multiple languages with region-specific assets or feature optional high-definition assets, can easily balloon to large sizes.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, learn how to use app packages and app bundles to customize your app so that your customers only receive the resources they actually need.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, learn how to use app packages and app bundles to customize your app so that your customers only receive the resources they actually need.

trans-unit.source: Game porting guides
trans-unit.target: Game porting guides

trans-unit.source: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, UWP, and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, UWP, and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Game programming resources
trans-unit.target: Game programming resources

trans-unit.source: For more info about game programming on Windows, check out the following resources.
trans-unit.target: For more info about game programming on Windows, check out the following resources.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).

trans-unit.source: To make the best use of the game development overviews and tutorials, you should be familiar with the following subjects:
trans-unit.target: To make the best use of the game development overviews and tutorials, you should be familiar with the following subjects:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft C++ with Component Extensions (C++/CX).
trans-unit.target: Microsoft C++ with Component Extensions (C++/CX).

trans-unit.source: This is an update to Microsoft C++ that incorporates automatic reference counting, and is the language for developing UWP games with DirectX 11.1 or later versions.
trans-unit.target: This is an update to Microsoft C++ that incorporates automatic reference counting, and is the language for developing UWP games with DirectX 11.1 or later versions.

trans-unit.source: Basic graphics programming terminology.
trans-unit.target: Basic graphics programming terminology.

trans-unit.source: Basic Windows programming concepts.
trans-unit.target: Basic Windows programming concepts.

trans-unit.source: Basic familiarity with the Direct3D 9 or 11 APIs.
trans-unit.target: Basic familiarity with the Direct3D 9 or 11 APIs.
